column1: 4.2.3.4	  Urodynamics  The role of urodynamics in SUI evaluation remains poorly defined and is still under debate.

Offer supervised intensive pelvic floor muscle training (PFMT), lasting at least three months,   as first-line therapy to all women with stress urinary incontinence (SUI) or mixed urinary   incontinence (including elderly women and pre- and postnatal women).
Ensure that PFMT programmes are as intensive as possible.
Balance the efficacy and lack of adverse events from PFMT against the expected effect and   complications from invasive surgery for SUI.
Consider electrical stimulation for treatment of SUI, or as an adjunct for teaching PFM   contraction.
